column4: Seanehawk : that's probably a broken grub.cfg file, if you can pastebin the contents of that file..
how do you load it without the grub menu?
when you type ls you get a bunch of partitions, use 'set root=(hdX,Y)' then 'linux /boot/<kernel file you have>' then 'initrd /boot/<corresponding initrd.img file>' then 'boot'
but the problem is i cant find which one is my ext3 filesystem
